dn10:1.6.3.pli: Ariyassa sīlakkhandhassa, ariyassa samādhikkhandhassa, ariyassa paññākkhandhassa.
dn10:1.6.3.en: The entire spectrum of noble ethics, immersion, and wisdom.

dn10:1.6.6.pli: “Katamo pana so, bho ānanda, ariyo sīlakkhandho, yassa so bhavaṁ gotamo vaṇṇavādī ahosi, yattha ca imaṁ janataṁ samādapesi nivesesi patiṭṭhāpesī”ti?
dn10:1.6.6.en: “But what was that entire spectrum of noble ethics that the Buddha praised?”

dn10:1.29.4.pli: So iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṁ anavajjasukhaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
dn10:1.29.4.en: When they have this entire spectrum of noble ethics, they experience a blameless happiness inside themselves.

dn10:1.30.1.pli: Ayaṁ kho so, māṇava, ariyo sīlakkhandho yassa so bhagavā vaṇṇavādī ahosi, yattha ca imaṁ janataṁ samādapesi nivesesi patiṭṭhāpesi.
dn10:1.30.1.en: This is that entire spectrum of noble ethics that the Buddha praised.

dn10:1.30.4.pli: So cāyaṁ, bho ānanda, ariyo sīlakkhandho paripuṇṇo, no aparipuṇṇo.
dn10:1.30.4.en: This entire spectrum of noble ethics is complete, not lacking anything!

dn10:1.30.6.pli: Evaṁ paripuṇṇañca, bho ānanda, ariyaṁ sīlakkhandhaṁ ito bahiddhā aññe samaṇabrāhmaṇā attani samanupasseyyuṁ, te tāvatakeneva attamanā assu:
dn10:1.30.6.en: Were other ascetics and brahmins to see such an entire spectrum of noble ethics in themselves, they’d be delighted with just that much:

dn10:2.5.1.pli: So iminā ca ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato, iminā ca ariyena indriyasaṁvarena samannāgato, iminā ca ariyena satisampajaññena samannāgato, imāya ca ariyāya santuṭṭhiyā samannāgato
dn10:2.5.1.en: When they have this entire spectrum of noble ethics, this noble sense restraint, this noble mindfulness and situational awareness, and this noble contentment,

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 10
With Subha

an5.22:1.3.pli: ‘Sekhaṁ dhammaṁ aparipūretvā sīlakkhandhaṁ paripūressatī’ti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
an5.22:1.3.en: Without fulfilling the practice of a trainee, it’s impossible to fulfill the entire spectrum of ethics.

an5.22:1.4.pli: ‘Sīlakkhandhaṁ aparipūretvā samādhikkhandhaṁ paripūressatī’ti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
an5.22:1.4.en: Without fulfilling the entire spectrum of ethics, it’s impossible to fulfill the entire spectrum of immersion.

an5.22:1.5.pli: ‘Samādhikkhandhaṁ aparipūretvā paññākkhandhaṁ paripūressatī’ti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
an5.22:1.5.en: Without fulfilling the entire spectrum of immersion, it’s impossible to fulfill the entire spectrum of wisdom.

an5.22:2.3.pli: ‘Sekhaṁ dhammaṁ paripūretvā sīlakkhandhaṁ paripūressatī’ti ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
an5.22:2.3.en: Having fulfilled the practice of a trainee, it’s possible to fulfill the entire spectrum of ethics.

an5.22:2.4.en: Having fulfilled the entire spectrum of ethics, it’s possible to fulfill the entire spectrum of immersion.

an5.22:2.5.en: Having fulfilled the entire spectrum of immersion, it’s possible to fulfill the entire spectrum of wisdom.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5.22
3. With Five Factors
Disrespect (2nd)

sn6.2:2.2.pli: “aparipuṇṇassa kho sīlakkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṁ.
sn6.2:2.2.en: “I’d honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of ethics, if it were incomplete.

sn6.2:3.1.pli: Aparipuṇṇassa kho samādhikkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṁ.
sn6.2:3.1.en: I’d honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of immersion, if it were incomplete.

sn6.2:4.1.pli: Aparipuṇṇassa paññākkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṁ.
sn6.2:4.1.en: I’d honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of wisdom, if it were incomplete.

sn6.2:5.1.pli: Aparipuṇṇassa kho vimuttikkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṁ.
sn6.2:5.1.en: I’d honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of freedom, if it were incomplete.

sn6.2:6.1.pli: Aparipuṇṇassa kho vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṁ.
sn6.2:6.1.en: I’d honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of the knowledge and vision of freedom, if it were incomplete.

mlDocs.title:

1. The Appeal
Respect

an3.26:3.5.pli: Iti aparipūraṁ vā sīlakkhandhaṁ paripūressāmi, paripūraṁ vā sīlakkhandhaṁ tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi;
an3.26:3.5.en: Thinking, ‘I’ll fulfill the entire spectrum of ethical conduct I haven’t yet fulfilled, or support with wisdom in every situation the ethical conduct I’ve already fulfilled.

an3.26:3.6.pli: aparipūraṁ vā samādhikkhandhaṁ paripūressāmi, paripūraṁ vā samādhikkhandhaṁ tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi;
an3.26:3.6.en: I’ll fulfill the entire spectrum of immersion I haven’t yet fulfilled, or support with wisdom in every situation the immersion I’ve already fulfilled.

an3.26:3.7.pli: aparipūraṁ vā paññākkhandhaṁ paripūressāmi, paripūraṁ vā paññākkhandhaṁ tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmīti.
an3.26:3.7.en: I’ll fulfill the entire spectrum of wisdom I haven’t yet fulfilled, or support with wisdom in every situation the wisdom I’ve already fulfilled.’

sn47.13:5.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho te, ānanda, sāriputto sīlakkhandhaṁ vā ādāya parinibbuto, samādhikkhandhaṁ vā ādāya parinibbuto, paññākkhandhaṁ vā ādāya parinibbuto, vimuttikkhandhaṁ vā ādāya parinibbuto, vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhaṁ vā ādāya parinibbuto”ti?
sn47.13:5.1.en: “Well, Ānanda, when Sāriputta was fully quenched, did he take away your entire spectrum of ethical conduct, of immersion, of wisdom, of freedom, or of the knowledge and vision of freedom?”
